news.title: Hanumankind: "I’ve just been open to picking up things from everywhere. So there’s a little bit of everywhere within me"
news.summary: Rising artist Hanumankind talks about his viral hit ‘Big Dawgs’, thick Houston accents, and his new mixtape, Monsoon Season.

news.title: Numerous Irish films to be showcased at Edinburgh International Film Festival
news.summary: Ireland's Minister for Culture, Patrick O'Donovan will be opening the festival on Tuesday during a networking brunch

news.summary: Spike Island is one of many highlights of Electric Picnic's beloved Freetown area, on the northwestern fringes of the festival...

news.title: Picture This announce Christmas Belfast and Dublin gigs
news.summary: The Home For Christmas shows will take place on December 27 and 29.

news.title: The Cribs to release new album Selling A Vibe
news.summary: The album will mark the band's first project in five years

news.title: 20 years ago today: The Philip Lynott statue was unveiled in Dublin
news.summary: On this day in 2005, Philip Lynott's native Dublin paid official tribute to the music icon with the unveiling of a statue on Harry Street. A huge crowd gathered for the event, which represented the culmination of many years of campaigning on the part of his mother, Philomena, and the Roisin Dubh Trust.
